p: The root of P. nigrum is used by the people of Thailand in the form of ghee, powders, enemas, and balms to treat to abdominal tumors, abdominal fullness, adenitis, cancer, cholera, cold, colic, kidney stone, asthma and headache [ 139]. In addition, the plant is also used in traditional Chinese medicine to treat epilepsy [ 140] and applied in some formulae to treat respiratory or gastric cancers in China [ 141, 142]. P. nigrum is also used in traditional Middle Eastern medicine as a nerve tonic [ 140]. In traditional Ayurvedic medicine, P. nigrum is used in combination with P. longum to treat intermittent fevers, to promote the secretion of bile and recommended for neurological, broncho-pulmonary and gastrointestinal disorders, (including dyspepsia, flatulence, constipation and hemorrhoids) [ 140]. Moreover, Agbor et al. [ 143] also reported on the folk medicine uses of fruits and leaves of P. nigrum for the treatment of coughs, intestinal diseases, bronchitis, venereal diseases, and rheumatism while Aziz et al. [ 144] cited the general application of P. nigrum for treating diarrhea, fever, cold, colic disorder and gastric conditions.
